business.headline: Hyderabad on track to become a global tech hub: D Sridhar BabuHyderabad is aiming to become a global technology hub, focusing on innovation, start-ups, and talent development. At the India Today Conclave South 2025, D Sridhar Babu, Minister for IT, E&C, Industries & Commerce, outlined the city's vision.
Sensex ends 314 points higher, Nifty above 24,850; Infosys gains 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 314.02 points to close at 81,101.32, while the NSE Nifty50 added 95.45 points to end at 24,868.60.

Karisma Kapur's children go to High Court, claim share in Sanjay Kapur's assetsSanjay Kapur's children, identified as the legal heirs, have filed a suit in Delhi High Court seeking partition of the estate, rendition of accounts, and a permanent injunction

Hyderabad aims to become a global technology hub, says D Sridhar BabuHyderabad, according to  D Sridhar Babu, is positioning itself as a global technology and innovation hub, with a strong focus on AI, start-ups, industry, and skill development, while aiming to balance economic growth with social welfare.

Ericsson lays off 100 Canadian employees amid global restructuringEricsson has confirmed that about 100 of its Canadian staff will lose their jobs as the company continues to restructure its workforce worldwide.
How can ease of business be improved in India's real estate sector?

The PF problem: Why so many employees struggle to access their own moneyEvery month, employees across India save a part of their salary in the Provident Fund. But system errors, bureaucratic delays, and glitches mean that for millions, claiming their own PF money has become a frustrating challenge.

How can India achieve affordable housing? Tata Realty CEO explainsSanjay Dutt, Managing Director and CEO of Tata Realty & Infrastructure Ltd, spoke about how India can work towards making affordable housing more accessible and practical.

From Agarwals to Patels: Which surnames rule India's richest family businesses?Behind India's richest family businesses lies an interesting pattern, certain surnames appear again and again. The Hurun India Rich List 2025 reveals which surnames dominate this legacy of wealth, with Agarwals, Guptas and Jains leading the pack.

Selling property? Here are 9 smart ways to save on capital gains taxSelling property can bring you a good profit, but it often comes with the worry of paying a hefty capital gains tax. Luckily, the Income Tax Act offers several ways to cut down or even avoid this tax if you plan wisely.

Cash, gold, property: How to protect your wedding gifts from tax troubleMost of these gifts are legally tax-free. Under Section 56(2)(x) of the Income Tax Act, gifts received by the bride or groom on the occasion of marriage are completely exempt from tax.

Amanta Healthcare IPO lists at 7% premium on stock market debutAmanta Healthcare share price: The pharmaceutical company listed at Rs 135 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), giving investors a 7.14% premium over the issue price of Rs 126.

entertainment.headline: Punjab floods: Salman's Being Human foundation sends boats, to adopt villagesActor Salman Khan's Being Human foundation has joined the rescue and relief work as Punjab faces floods. The foundation has sent five boats to flood-affected areas. It has also planned to adopt flood-hit border villages near Husainiwala.

Is Rise & Fall what Bigg Boss once used to be?'Rise & Fall' debuts as a fresh reality show focusing on power and social divides. Here's a look at how this show will remind you what 'Bigg Boss' used to be.

Gandhi premiere at Tiff 2025: Hansal Mehta's series wins standing ovationFilmmaker Hansal Mehta's series 'Gandhi' had its grand premiere at the 50th Toronto International Film Festival. The series even received a standing ovation at the festival.

KBC 17: IAS aspirant fails to answer Rs 7.5 lakh question. Can you?Kaun Banega Crorepati 17: In the episode aired on September 8, the first contestant, Abhishek, took the hot seat. However, his journey came to an end at the Rs 7.5 lakh question, one that even the audience failed to answer correctly. Can you answer this?

Vashu Bhagnani claims Ali Abbas Zafar inflated Bade Miyan budget by Rs 80 croreProducer Vashu Bhagnani recently levied serious allegations against director Ali Abbas Zafar. Bhagnani accused the filmmaker of money laundering.

Prithviraj on Aadujeevitham National Awards snub: Films are meant for audienceActor Prithviraj Sukumaran recently reacted to the National Film Awards snub for 'Aadujeevitham: The Goat Life'. He reflected on the need to prioritise the theatre audience over film festivals or award shows.

Salman Khan cleans up in wounded look from Battle of Galwan's Ladakh shoot. See picActor Salman Khan has shared the first look from his upcoming film 'Battle of Galwan'. The film's climax scenes are currently being shot in Leh and Ladakh. Directed by Apoorva Lakhia, the film recounts the 2020 Galwan Valley clash.

My father used to beat me: Tanya recalls abuse as Kunickaa attacks her in BB 19Tanya Mittal broke down in 'Bigg Boss 19' after Kunickaa Sadanand questioned her upbringing. The influencer recalled facing violence from her father while growing up.

Mirai gets U/A certificate, Teja Sajja calls it experience of emotion and devotionActor Teja Sajja's 'Mirai' has been officially cleared by the CBFC with a U/A certificate ahead of its global release. The upcoming superhero film will be releasing in 2D and 3D formats.
Ali Fazal attends Rule Breakers screening at UK Parliament with MP Alice McDonaldActor Ali Fazal attended the screening of 'Rule Breakers'' at UK Parliament. He was joined by MP Alice McDonald.

Tanishaa Mukerji says outsiders lack loyalty, opens up on Uday Chopra, Armaan KohliActor Tanishaa Mukerji opened up about her breakups with Uday Chopra and Armaan Kohli, while also calling Bollywood outsiders "not loyal" to the industry.

Hina slams Farrhana for belittling Ashnoor's TV career, calls her a wannabeActor Hina Khan criticised Farrhana Bhatt for commenting about Ashnoor Kaur's television background on 'Bigg Boss 19'. She later deleted the post.

Allu Arjun receives show-cause notice from corporation over illegal constructionActor Allu Arjun has been served a show-cause notice by Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) for unauthorised construction at his Jubilee Hills property. The notice threatens demolition of the illegal extension, raising concerns about compliance and legal action.

Rakesh Roshan confirms Krrish 4's release in 2027, shooting to begin next yearVeteran filmmaker Rakesh Roshan recently shared that his son Hrithik Roshan's 'Krrish 4' is expected to release in theatres in 2027. The shooting will begin in 2026.

Bigg Boss 19 day 15: Kunickaa-Tanya's clash escalates, Mridul confronts NataliaDay 15 of 'Bigg Boss 19' saw explosive confrontations amongst housemates. Kunickaa Sadanand and Tanya Mittal had a notably intense argument in the kitchen and later during the nomination task. The episode also featured Mridul Tiwari confessing his feelings for Natalia Janoszek.

Baaghi 4 box office Day 4: Major Monday drop for Tiger's film hints at bleak futureTiger Shroff's 'Baaghi 4' struggled on its first Monday with collections dropping to Rs 4.25 crore, taking the film's four-day total to Rs 35.50 crore at the Indian box office.

Elumale review: Impressive thriller blends romance with Veerappan's manhuntRelease Date:Fri Sep 05, 2025Elumale movie review: The rooted Kannada film, written and directed by debutant Punit Rangaswamy, is set in 2004 and weaves love, family drama, and crime thriller elements effectively.

general news.headline: Nepal PM Oli resigns after Army Chief asks him to quit amid Gen Z protestsProtests continued in Nepal for the second day despite the government announcing that it had lifted the ban on social media platforms. Demonstrators demanded Oli's ouster and the government's dismissal after 20 people were killed on Monday and over 250 injured.

Live: Toll in Nepal protests rises to 22; ex-PM KP Sharma Oli may leave countryKP Sharma Oli resigned as Nepal's Prime Minister on Tuesday following violent protests triggered by a ban on major social media platforms and anger over corruption. At least 22 people were killed and hundreds injured as police used deadly force against demonstrators, mostly youths leading what came to be called the "Gen Z" movement. Despite the government rolling back the ban, protests intensified on the second day, with crowds attacking and injuring Nepalese leaders. India Today is reporting live from ground zero in Nepal. Pankaj Das, Amit Bharadwaj and Rohit Singh are present at the scene. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Numbers back NDA in vice-presidential election battle, result likely by 8 pmThe election comes fifty days after Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned from the post on July 21, citing health reasons. The vacancy triggered a fresh contest for the nation's second-highest constitutional office, and with it, a political test of strength between the ruling NDA and the opposition INDIA bloc.

Fungus on hands, smelly clothes, can't live in jail: Darshan asks judge for poisonActor Darshan, accused in the Renukaswamy murder case in Karnataka, pleaded with the judge to give him poison, citing unbearable jail conditions. The judge refused his request.

How Nepal is following Bangladesh script, line for line | 5 pointsNepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli resigned on Tuesday after protests by youngsters over social media ban turned into an anti-regime agitation. Nepal's Gen Z protests have uncanny similarities to the Bangladesh agitation from July-August 2024 that toppled the regime of PM Sheikh Hasina. Here's a 5-point explainer.t

With Nepal, India's neighbourhood in turmoil again. US vs China playing out?Nepal protests: What started as an agitation in Nepal against a social media ban, quickly spiralled into protests against corruption, forcing Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli to resign. It follows a familiar script that happened in Bangladesh and Sri Lanka.

Karisma Kapur's children go to High Court, claim share in Sanjay Kapur's assetsSanjay Kapur's children, identified as the legal heirs, have filed a suit in Delhi High Court seeking partition of the estate, rendition of accounts, and a permanent injunction

Live: Voting in Veep election still on, NDA sets table for celebration dinnerVice President Election 2025 Voting Live Updates: India will have a new Vice President by Tuesday night, with members of Parliament voting to fill the post left vacant after Jagdeep Dhankhar's abrupt resignation. The contest has pitted the BJP-led ruling NDA's nominee, Maharashtra Governor CP Radhakrishnan, against the opposition INDIA bloc's choice, former Supreme Court judge B Sudershan Reddy. Polling will begin at 10 am in the new Parliament building, with members of both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha eligible to cast their votes until 5 pm. Counting of ballots will start at 6 pm, and the results are expected later in the evening. Although the BJP-led alliance has a numerical advantage, the outcome could hinge on cross-voting since MPs are not bound by a party whip and ballots are cast in secrecy. Stay with IndiaToday.in for live updates

Oli, India and the curious timing of Nepal protestsThe massive protests in Nepal in which 20 people have been killed came ahead of PM KP Sharma Oli's planned trip to India and after his return from China. India's immediate neighbourhood has become a playground of diverse external forces. Though the Gen Z protests seem to be spontaneous, they come amid China-US tug-of-war and can be hijacked, warn experts.

Video: Nepal Finance Minister chased on street, kicked, thrashed by protestersNepal's Finance Minister Bishnu Prasad Paudel was attacked by protesters during intense Gen Z protests. The violent clashes erupted as thousands of young protesters confronted security forces in Kathmandu and several other cities across the country. Despite the government lifting the ban on social media platforms, protests in Nepal persisted into their second day. Nepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli resigned on Tuesday. In his resignation letter, Oli said he was stepping down "to facilitate a solution to the problem and to help resolve it politically." The first day of Gen Z protests left 20 people dead and more than 250 injured.

Noida woman's 'I choose to leave India' post sparks debate on reservation policiesA Noida-based woman shared that she is leaving India to pursue an MBA abroad after failing to secure admission to the institutes she considered the "best" in the country, blaming reservation policies for it. Her LinkedIn post has now sparked a debate on the issue. Read on:

Why MPs need training for Vice-Presidential election? It's complicatedThe Vice-President election is scheduled for September 9, and MPs from both the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha are undergoing training to understand the complex voting process. Here's a closer look at how both Presidential and Vice Presidential elections are conducted and why MPs need training.

Only Murders in the Building Season 5 review: Equal parts whodunnit and comedyRelease Date:Tue Sep 09, 2025Only Murders in the Building season 5 is here with Lester's murder, billionaire suspects, and Logan Lerman's big debut—crime has never been this funny.

Watch: India Today reports from epicentre of Nepal's massive Gen Z uprisingKathmandu is seething. For the second day in a row, Nepal's youth-led uprising raged on, defying curbs on public gatherings and a heavy security clampdown. The turmoil culminated on Tuesday with Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli's resignation, hours after hundreds of demonstrators stormed his office shouting anti-government slogans.

"This protest is not only about the social media ban, but about the corruption happening under Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli's government. We are forced to take the route of violence to show dissent. Children were killed yesterday. They could have handled it peacefully, but instead they shot us," a protester told India Today TV. 

On Monday, violence reached a flashpoint. At least 20 people were killed and more than 300 injured in the violent clashes. Four more were reported injured on Tuesday. The agitators torched Prime Minister Oli's residence in Balkot. They also attacked the house of former home minister Ramesh Lekhak, who resigned a day earlier.

Indian couple assaulted by Chinese man during Switzerland holiday, shares post, picsAn Indian-origin couple alleged that they were brutally assaulted by a Chinese hotel manager during their holiday in Switzerland.
Ahmedabad couple dies of electrocution as bike stuck in waterlogged potholeThe woman was electrocuted first, and her husband died moments later while trying to save her.

Video: Protesters storm Hilton hotel in Kathmandu, fire, thick smoke seenFollowing attacks on government buildings and leaders' residences, protesters have vandalized and set fire to Kathmandu's Hilton Hotel, owned by a ruling party leader.

Ahead of iPhone 17 launch, full design leaked. Here's how the phones will lookApple is set to announce the iPhone 17 series tonight at 10:30PM IST, and hours before the official unveiling, leaks and dummy models have already painted a clear picture of what the upcoming lineup will look like.

New advisory, helpline numbers issued for Indians in Nepal, airlines cancel flightsIndia has advised its citizens in Nepal to exercise caution after violent Gen Z protests left at least 20 dead and prompted curfews in several cities. Indian Airlines have also suspended flight services to Nepal amid raging protests.

Canada rejects 80% Indian student visas in 2025, top choice status fallsCanada, once a top destination for study-abroad aspirants, rejected 80% of visa applications for Indian students in 2025, the highest in a decade. Barely 9% of Indian study abroad aspirants now see it as the top choice. With growing uncertainty and mounting challenges, what does studying in Canada look like now, and what new study-abroad dreams are Indian students embracing?

Meet the Maruti Suzuki SUV with a lot of firsts, challenging Creta, SeltosMaruti Suzuki Victoris is a feature-loaded mid-size SUV under the Arena umbrella, packed with brand-first technologies and premium touches to rival the Hyundai Creta, Kia Seltos and more.

Ex-Nepal PM and foreign minister wife attacked during protests, hospitalisedFormer Nepal Prime Minister Sher Bahadur Deuba and his wife, Foreign Minister Arzu Deuba, were attacked by a mob during the ongoing Gen Z protests and rushed to the hospital. The protests, which have left 22 dead and over 250 injured, also saw Finance Minister Bishnu Prasad Paudel beaten up by protesters, while Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli resigned on Tuesday to help resolve the crisis politically.

Very confident Rahul Gandhi will be PM in 2029, says DK ShivakumarIn a wide-ranging interview at India Today's South Conclave, DK Shivakumar spoke about his relationship with Siddaramaiah, controversy over him singing the RSS anthem and the Dharmasthala case.

Can a combined MBBS-Ayurveda degree produce competent doctors?The Jawaharlal Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education and Research (JIPMER), Puducherry, may soon offer India's first integrated MBBS-BAMS programme, aiming to train doctors in both modern medicine and Ayurveda. While the initiative promises interdisciplinary learning, experts and activists raise legal, regulatory, and patient safety concerns.

sports.headline: Josh Hazlewood shuts retirement talks of Australia pace trio with Starc, CumminsJosh Hazlewood has brushed aside talk of retirement for Australia's pace trio. He insists he, Pat Cummins, and Mitchell Starc still have unfinished business in Test cricket, keeping their era alive beyond the upcoming Ashes.

PBKS was eager to hear me, KKR did not keep me in the mix: Shreyas IyerShreyas Iyer said that during his time at Kolkata Knight Riders, he felt involved but not fully included in major decisions, eventually leading him to part ways after winning the title. Now with the Punjab Kings, he enjoys greater support and respect from the management.

Rashid Khan's wounded Afghanistan look to stamp authority vs Hong KongWounded Afghanistan begin their Asia Cup 2025 campaign with a match against Hong Kong. Will Afghanistan's recent failure in tri-series final affect their show in Asia Cup 2025?

I'll text you: Suryakumar Yadav's cheeky reply on Sanju Samson selection queryIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav lightened the mood on Sanju Samson's selection ahead of Asia Cup 2025. The decision remains uncertain as Shubman Gill's return complicates team balance and future planning.

Can't have India vs Pakistan without aggression: Suryakumar YadavThere is no way that India and Pakistan can be played without aggression on the field, said Suryakumar Yadav and Salman Agha ahead of the clash of the arch-rivals. The duo spoke in the pre-tournament press conference.

UAE bowler shares unique connection to Shubman Gill, now they meet at Asia Cup 2025Simranjeet Singh recalls bowling to Shubman Gill as he prepares to face India in Asia Cup 2025. His journey from Punjab to UAE cricket highlights resilience and cultural acceptance.

Sabalenka's hilarious fumble on TV, calls Carlos Alcaraz Jannik SinnerUS Open champions Aryna Sabalenka and Carlos Alcaraz were put together in a TV programme. In the show, Sabalenka had a hilarious fumble when she mistakenly addressed Alcaraz as Jannik Sinner.

Kevin Pietersen baffled by Yashasvi Jaiswal's Asia Cup snub: He's a major starKevin Pietersen was puzzled at how Yashasvi Jaiswal's omission was not included in India's Asia Cup squad. The former England captain sees the young opening batter as the next big star in Indian cricket.

Rishabh Pant targets return in West Indies series after rehab in Bengaluru: ReportRishabh Pant is reportedly set to begin rehabilitation in Bengaluru after fracturing his foot in England. He is expected to return during the West Indies Test series.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
